medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent pigmented lesion on the left cheek.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noticed a small brown freckle at age 34, which slowly enlarged over the next decade. At age 44, she presented with a 1 cm pigmented macule diagnosed as lentigo maligna (LM). After several excisions, the lesion persisted, gradually tripling in size over the next decade with no suspicious areas for invasive melanoma noted until 1987. In 1995, the lesion was found to show possible early invasion, leading to its excision and diagnosis of a lentigo maligna melanoma (LMM).
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of multiple excisions of lentigo maligna, previous excision of a pigmented lesion on the right calf in 1966 diagnosed as LM, which later recurred and was diagnosed as invasive melanoma.
medical_history.family_history: A brother with nodular melanoma and another brother with lentigo maligna on his face treated with radiation.
